definition: sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack

sentences.english: The old man was wandering on the streets selling sugarcoated haws on sticks.
sentences.chinese: 卖冰糖葫芦的老爷爷走街串巷地叫卖。

sentences.english: Nice color crystal-sugar berry , and one scene of the making progress.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的糖葫芦，还可以看到制作过程。

sentences.english: Candied-haws looks sweet and cute, but inside, it is hardy, sour and astringent.
sentences.chinese: 糖葫芦的表面甜美可人，但内核却是坚硬酸涩的。

sentences.english: Ah, I know Tanghulu. It is made of haws.
sentences.chinese: 啊，我知道糖葫芦，就是那种包。

sentences.english: Hot pot, Beijing roast duck, tomatoes on sticks Peking noodles, and so on…
sentences.chinese: 火锅，北京烤鸭，糖葫芦，炸酱面等等。

sentences.english: We are now looking at the photo is the candied fruit .
sentences.chinese: 大家现在看的这幅图片是糖葫芦。

sentences.english: Controlled the air conditioning button which on the stage arranged in turn to let me associate the candied fruit.
sentences.chinese: 中控台上依次排列的空调按钮让我联想起了糖葫芦。

sentences.english: Your can buy sugar-coated haws on a stick in the Chinatown.
sentences.chinese: 你们可以在唐人街买到糖葫芦。

sentences.english: The old man is selling sirupy calabashes.
sentences.chinese: 河南洛阳卖糖葫芦的老汉。

definition: tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
buckwheat pudding (snack of buckwheat noodles with sauce)
shaved or crushed ice dessert or beverage
